publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4865 Dr Jean Turner: Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006—That the Parliament commends Stroke Awareness Week in Scotland, from 2 to 8 October 2006, which is an annual health campaign that aims to increase public knowledge of strokes and the need for urgent diagnoses because of its devastating effects; notes that every five minutes someone in the United Kingdom has a stroke and that it is the biggest cause of disability in the UK and, contrary to popular belief, can affect anyone at any age; further notes that Chest, Heart and Stroke Scotland’s theme this year is "Just Move", which is the encouragement of physical activity and walking in the Scottish population; recognises that less than 70% of adults undertake the recommended 30 minutes of activity on most days of the week, and notes therefore that Chest, Heart and Stroke Scotland’s aim is to promote the health benefits of regular exercise which hopefully everyone can join in, whatever their level of fitness.

S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Karen Gillon*, Murray Tosh*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Bill Butler*, Donald Gorrie*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Shiona Baird*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Robin Harper*, Alex Neil*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Ms Sandra White*, Derek Brownlee*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Christine Grahame*, Margaret Mitchell*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Bill Aitken*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Chris Ballance*, John Swinburne*, Euan Robson*, Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*

S2M-4865 Dr Jean Turner: Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006—That the Parliament commends Stroke Awareness Week in Scotland, from 2 to 8 October 2006, which is an annual health campaign that aims to increase public knowledge of strokes and the need for urgent diagnoses because of its devastating effects; notes that every five minutes someone in the United Kingdom has a stroke and that it is the biggest cause of disability in the UK and, contrary to popular belief, can affect anyone at any age; further notes that Chest, Heart and Stroke Scotland’s theme this year is "Just Move", which is the encouragement of physical activity and walking in the Scottish population; recognises that less than 70% of adults undertake the recommended 30 minutes of activity on most days of the week, and notes therefore that Chest, Heart and Stroke Scotland’s aim is to promote the health benefits of regular exercise which hopefully everyone can join in, whatever their level of fitness. Supported by: Karen Gillon, Murray Tosh, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Nanette Milne, Bill Butler, Donald Gorrie, Mike Pringle, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Shiona Baird, Carolyn Leckie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Jamie Stone, Robin Harper, Alex Neil, Sarah Boyack, Mr Jim Wallace, Ms Sandra White, Derek Brownlee, Mr Mark Ruskell, Christine Grahame, Margaret Mitchell, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Bill Aitken, Chris Ballance, John Swinburne, Euan Robson, Frances Curran, Rosie Kane, Dave Petrie*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4865 Stroke Awareness Week, 2 to 8 October 2006 (lodged on 26 September 2006) Roseanna Cunningham*
